title: dummy1
relevance: dummy example 1

title: dummy2
relevance: dummy example 2

title: Introducing GPT-5.2-Codex
relevance: Official release of an agentic coding model emphasizing long-horizon workflows, reliable tool use, and token-efficient reasoning (practical test-time compute).

title: Introducing GPT-5.2
relevance: Details GPT-5.2 “Thinking/Pro” modes and API reasoning controls—directly relevant to test-time compute allocation for reasoning.

title: Introducing Gemini 3: our most intelligent model that helps you bring any idea to life
relevance: Announces Gemini 3 with “thinking”/Deep Think reasoning modes and agentic capabilities, relevant to inference-time reasoning/compute.

title: Equipping agents for the real world with Agent Skills
relevance: Introduces (and updates) a modular skills system for tool-using agents—key infrastructure for agent planning, portability, and reliable execution.

title: anthropics/skills — Agent Skills repository (spec + examples)
relevance: Official repository containing the Agent Skills spec and example skills (instructions/scripts/resources) for composable, discoverable agent capabilities.

title: Agent Skills
relevance: Technical commentary highlighting implementation-relevant details and gaps in the Agent Skills open specification.

title: The Art of Scaling Test-Time Compute for Large Language Models
relevance: Large-scale empirical comparison of test-time scaling strategies across models/datasets, offering guidance for practical TTS selection.

title: When Does Verification Pay Off? A Closer Look at LLMs as Solution Verifiers
relevance: Systematic solver–verifier study (including cross-family verification) and introduction of “verifier gain” for test-time scaling.

title: EpiPlanAgent: Agentic Automated Epidemic Response Planning
relevance: Multi-agent LLM workflow for real planning/validation (decomposition, grounding, simulation), illustrating agentic planning in a high-stakes domain.

title: Graph-O1 : Monte Carlo Tree Search with Reinforcement Learning for Text-Attributed Graph Reasoning
relevance: Agentic GraphRAG approach combining MCTS + RL for interactive stepwise reasoning over graphs—planning/search applied to reasoning tasks.

title: Budget-Aware Tool-Use Enables Effective Agent Scaling
relevance: Shows that tool-call budgets require explicit budget awareness; proposes budget-aware planning/verification (BATS) for scalable tool-using agents.

title: Agentic Program Verification
relevance: LLM agent that iteratively refines proofs via interaction with the Rocq/Coq theorem prover—tight tool-feedback loops for structured reasoning.

title: ReAcTree: Hierarchical LLM Agent Trees with Control Flow for Long-Horizon Task Planning
relevance: Hierarchical agent-tree decomposition and control flow for long-horizon planning beyond monolithic trajectories (ReAct-style baselines).

title: MarsRL: Advancing Multi-Agent Reasoning System via Reinforcement Learning with Agentic Pipeline Parallelism
relevance: RL framework that trains multi-agent solver/verifier/corrector pipelines efficiently—relevant to building strong multi-agent reasoning systems.

title: Generalizing Test-time Compute-optimal Scaling as an Optimizable Graph
relevance: Formalizes compute-optimal test-time scaling as a graph optimization problem over roles/models/topologies in multi-LLM collaboration.

title: MASPRM: Multi-Agent System Process Reward Model
relevance: Introduces a process reward model for multi-agent transcripts to steer inference-time beam search/MCTS and spend compute more effectively.

title: milad1378yz/MASPRM
relevance: Code to reproduce MASPRM and integrate process-reward-guided search into multi-agent reasoning pipelines.

title: Unifying Tree Search Algorithm and Reward Design for LLM Reasoning: A Survey
relevance: Survey/taxonomy linking tree search mechanisms and reward formulation across test-time scaling and self-improving reasoning agents.

title: Limits of PRM-Guided Tree Search for Mathematical Reasoning with LLMs
relevance: Empirical evidence that PRM-guided tree search can fail to beat best-of-N due to reward model depth/generalization issues—important for TTS design.

title: Test-time Verification via Optimal Transport: Coverage, ROC, & Sub-optimality
relevance: Theory for verifier-based test-time scaling analyzing generator coverage, verifier ROC, and sampling sub-optimality tradeoffs.

title: Budget-aware Test-time Scaling via Discriminative Verification
relevance: Proposes discriminative verification as a compute-efficient alternative to generative verifiers, improving performance under fixed inference budgets.

title: On the Role of Temperature Sampling in Test-Time Scaling
relevance: Shows single-temperature best-of-K saturates and proposes multi-temperature scaling to enlarge the set of problems solved at test time.

title: ARM: Discovering Agentic Reasoning Modules for Generalizable Multi-Agent Systems
relevance: Automatically discovers modular reasoning steps via tree search over code—treating CoT as a unit to optimize for generalizable multi-agent reasoning.

title: Prompting Test-Time Scaling Is A Strong LLM Reasoning Data Augmentation
relevance: Uses test-time scaling prompting to synthesize diverse reasoning trajectories for finetuning—bridges inference-time scaling and training improvements.

title: Thinking vs. Doing: Agents that Reason by Scaling Test-Time Interaction
relevance: Argues agents can scale capability by extending interaction horizon (exploration/backtracking/replanning), complementing token-based test-time compute.

title: What, How, Where, and How Well? A Survey on Test-Time Scaling in Large Language Models
relevance: Comprehensive taxonomy/survey of test-time scaling techniques, applications (including agentic tasks), and evaluation dimensions.

title: testtimescaling/testtimescaling.github.io (companion repo to TTS survey)
relevance: Companion repository with a structured map of TTS methods plus figures/tables and ongoing updates for tracking the field.

title: s1: Simple test-time scaling
relevance: Influential open baseline for test-time compute control (“budget forcing”) and small curated reasoning data to elicit stronger reasoning.

title: simplescaling/s1
relevance: Open-source implementation and data for s1 and budget forcing—useful for reproducing and extending test-time scaling experiments.

title: ThreeSR/Awesome-Inference-Time-Scaling
relevance: Curated, frequently updated reading list of inference/test-time scaling papers (verifiers, search, MCTS, PRMs), helpful for ongoing monitoring.

title: DeepSeek-R1: Incentivizing Reasoning Capability in LLMs via Reinforcement Learning
relevance: Landmark paper showing pure RL can elicit reasoning capabilities without SFT, achieving o1-level performance on math/code benchmarks.

title: DeepSeek-R1 GitHub Repository
relevance: Open-source release of DeepSeek's reasoning models including distilled versions from 1.5B to 70B parameters under MIT license.

title: Learning to reason with LLMs
relevance: OpenAI's foundational post on o1 reasoning model explaining chain-of-thought via reinforcement learning and test-time compute scaling.

title: Introducing OpenAI o3 and o4-mini
relevance: Latest o-series reasoning models with agentic tool use, representing state-of-the-art in combined reasoning and tool capabilities.

title: Scaling LLM Test-Time Compute Optimally can be More Effective than Scaling Model Parameters
relevance: Key Berkeley research showing test-time compute scaling can outperform 14x larger models on certain problems via compute-optimal strategies.

title: What, How, Where, and How Well? A Survey on Test-Time Scaling in Large Language Models
relevance: Comprehensive survey organizing TTS research across what to scale, how to scale, where to apply, and evaluation metrics.

title: Claude's extended thinking
relevance: Anthropic's approach to hybrid reasoning with configurable thinking budgets and visible thought process for Claude models.

title: The 'think' tool: Enabling Claude to stop and think
relevance: New technique allowing Claude to pause during tool calling chains for deliberate reasoning, showing 54% improvement on agentic tasks.

title: An Easy Introduction to LLM Reasoning, AI Agents, and Test Time Scaling
relevance: Comprehensive NVIDIA tutorial covering LLM agents, reasoning patterns, and test-time compute techniques like chain-of-thought and tree-of-thought.

title: What is test-time compute and how to scale it?
relevance: Practical guide covering 5 methods for scaling test-time compute including DeepSeek-R1's approach and reinforcement learning techniques.

title: LangChain and LangGraph Agent Frameworks Reach v1.0 Milestones
relevance: Major stable release of production-ready agent frameworks with durable execution, human-in-the-loop, and comprehensive memory.

title: Plan-and-Execute Agents
relevance: LangGraph architectures for plan-and-execute style agents that separate planning from execution for improved multi-step reasoning.

title: Gemini thinking | Gemini API
relevance: Official Gemini API documentation on thinking modes with configurable thinking budgets for Gemini 2.5/3 series models.

title: QwQ-32B: Embracing the Power of Reinforcement Learning
relevance: Open-source 32B reasoning model achieving DeepSeek-R1-level performance with smaller compute requirements under Apache 2.0 license.

title: Tree of Thoughts: Deliberate Problem Solving with Large Language Models
relevance: Foundational paper on ToT prompting enabling LLMs to explore multiple reasoning paths with backtracking, achieving 74% on Game of 24 vs 4% for CoT.

title: From LLM Reasoning to Autonomous AI Agents: A Comprehensive Review
relevance: Comprehensive survey covering ~60 benchmarks, agent frameworks, and collaboration protocols (ACP, MCP, A2A) from 2019-2025.

title: A Survey of Frontiers in LLM Reasoning: Inference Scaling, Learning to Reason, and Agentic Systems
relevance: Survey organizing reasoning research across inference scaling, learning-to-reason, and single/multi-agent systems with unified framework.

title: Agentic Reasoning: A Streamlined Framework for Enhancing LLM Reasoning with Agentic Tools
relevance: Framework integrating Mind-Map memory, web search agents, and computational tools into reasoning chains for deep research tasks.

title: OpenAI announces new o3 models
relevance: Coverage of o3 announcement with record benchmark scores: 87.5% on ARC-AGI, 96.7% on AIME, 71.7% on SWE-Bench Verified.

title: Gemini 2.0 Flash 'Thinking mode'
relevance: Technical deep-dive on Google's first reasoning model with practical examples and llm-gemini plugin implementation.

title: Top 5 LangGraph Agents in Production 2024
relevance: Real-world production case studies from LinkedIn, Elastic, Replit showing controllable agent architectures with LangGraph.

title: AI agents debate their way to improved mathematical reasoning
relevance: Research on Adaptive Heterogeneous Multi-Agent Debate framework achieving 4-6% higher accuracy and 30% fewer factual errors.

title: Rethinking the Bounds of LLM Reasoning: Are Multi-Agent Discussions the Key?
relevance: ACL 2024 paper finding single-agent LLMs with strong prompts can match multi-agent discussion performance on reasoning tasks.

title: Gemini 2.0 Flash Thinking Experimental: A Guide With Examples
relevance: Practical guide to Google's reasoning model with benchmarks showing 73.3% on AIME2024 vs 35.5% for base Flash model.

title: Scaling up Test-Time Compute with Latent Reasoning: A Recurrent Depth Approach
relevance: Novel architecture for test-time compute scaling using recurrent blocks for implicit reasoning in latent space.

title: How Scaling Laws Drive Smarter, More Powerful AI
relevance: NVIDIA's perspective on test-time scaling enabling AI reasoning models that can require 100x compute for complex queries.

title: DeepSeek-R1 incentivizes reasoning in LLMs through reinforcement learning
relevance: Peer-reviewed Nature publication validating DeepSeek-R1's RL-based reasoning approach and emergence of self-reflection capabilities.
